full_text:
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA, v PAUL M. DAUGERDAS, ET AL.,
February 15, 2012
Page 125 - Page 128 (32)
C2FFDAU4 Conrad - direct Page 125
1 A. Sir, tab 3?
2 Q. Tab 3, yes.
3 A. All right.
4 MR. GAIR: Your Honor, at this time I would move the admission of PMD3.
5 THE COURT: Any objection?
6 MR. OKULA: No, your Honor.
7 THE COURT: PMD 3 is received in evidence.
8 (Exhibit PMD 3 received in evidence)
9
10 Q. If you would look at page 10 of the transcript, it's got page 5 at the bottom, but then on the right side there are page numbers 9, 10 and 11. Tell me when you've got that.
11 A. Okay. Yes, sir.
12 Q. Okay, and if you look at beginning at line 8, the Court says, "Do you want to complete this affidavit now so that I can make a determination as to whether or not you can afford counsel?"
13 And you said, "I can't afford counsel, that's correct, sir."
14 Do you remember that happening?
15 A. If it's here then it happened, sir.
16 Q. And I'm asking you now do you remember it?
17 A. Yeah, probably.
18 Q. Okay. And you understood that you needed to qualify in order to have an attorney appointed for you, correct?
19 A. I didn't know specifically, specifically what the qualifications are or were.
20 Q. But you knew it was a financial qualification, correct?
21 A. Probably.
22 Q. Okay. And you understood that you would have to fill out a financial affidavit, did you not?
23 A. I don't know how to answer that. Maybe eventually.
24 Q. Well, when the Court said do you want to complete this affidavit now so that I can make a determination as to whether or not you can afford counsel, did you understand at that point that you had to complete a financial affidavit?
25 A. I don't know, sir.
...
Page 125 - Page 128 (32)
SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS

additional_notes: The document is a court transcript from the United States of America vs. Paul M. Daugerdas et al. The transcript is from February 15, 2012, and includes pages 125-128. The document appears to be a legal proceeding with questions and answers between lawyers and a witness.
